Summary: We stayed for almost 2 weeks and in all honesty, we had a great time. We felt mostly at home and the complimentary breakfast and free parking made a difference in comfort and convenience.  The location is just perfect.  Brie at the front desk was the sweetest and most accommodating staff member who did all she could to make our stay pleasent.  Got a chance to meet the owner and he dog and it was really pleasent as well.  Looking forward to coming back.
Room tip: Manage your expectations, look at the pictures to see clearly what it is and you'll be fine.

Summary: Wasn't impressed at all. Stayed here for Ohana Fest and paid way too much for this motel. Walls are super thin and we heard a baby crying most of the time. Won't stay here again. The only plus was that it's close to the ocean. I wouldn't stay here for a family vacation though.
Room tip: Find somewhere else to stay unless you HAVE to be in Laguna Beach

Summary: A honeymoon trip, we stayed for 5 nights. It‚Äôs a motel, with our standard queen room situated on the ground floor. A passageway and plant pots separated our room from the car park.   Room - Our room was disappointingly small and the shower room was tiny. Storage space is minimal, a small cupboard with 5 clothes hangers, a shelf and one drawer in a bedside table was insufficient for garments. Our belongings remained in our cases which we had to walk around on the floor. With no storage in the bathroom our toiletries were placed on a stool in front of the loud air conditioning unit.   The drapes are thin and we kept them closed to maintain some privacy, our room could be viewed by motel passers-by. The room was therefore rather dark and we needed a lamp on during the day.

I can‚Äôt say this is the worst hotel I‚Äôve ever stayed in! But for the prices they are charging, it‚Äôs way overpriced.  This is (or was) a motel that‚Äôs been upgraded but not completely, the shower in our room was tiny and original. It‚Äôs not bad but it‚Äôs not what we were expecting. The view was odd but that‚Äôs not their fault but still it‚Äôs not what one expects for this price range.

This was our 4th year staying at Seaside, and as always, it was a wonderful stay! The staff is so friendly, and accommodating. Bre (manager) always goes above and beyond. Such a great boutique hotel. We already cant wait to come back!  C. Greene

We booked a king room with an ocean view with this hotel mainly because they are pet friendly.  Our stay was for three nights, there is an additional charge of 65.00 per night for deep cleaning because of the dog, total charges for the stay was almost 2000.00 dollars.  This place is old, smelly, the supposed ocean view is non existant, there are no outlets to plug anything into, the faucet in the bathroom could be turned 80 degrees, the faucet in the shower was in need of some plumbers grease (very difficult to turn on and off).  We had been out for the day and returned around 4:00 p.m. to find the housekeeper cleaning, she did not even sweep the floor let alone mop it, why am I being charged additionally for pet cleaning???  These hotels are their pet cleaning fees are a total

Summary Heading: This is a you get what you pay for hotel but not in a bad way.
Summary: The look of the hotel is very original.  My daughter and I loved how the hotel was covered in vines and flowers.  We loved the pergola, statues and water fountain.  It is obvious that this is an older hotel.  It is very basic in its amenities.  The layout of the room, kitchen and bathroom is a little awkward but functional.  The hotel was clean.  No one is available after a certain time of the night so after 11, you are on your own.  The complementary breakfast is a joke so plan on getting breakfast somewhere else.  Parking is available on site which is a plus.  The bathroom was small but the shower was nice and spacious, no tub in our room.  This hotel is not directly on the beach, you will have to walk pass other homes/vacation rentals to get to a public access to the beach.

We unfortunately had a terrible one night experience where we couldn‚Äôt initially get the heater turned on, called front desk and never heard back - eventually turned on - with light on all night and between that, dust flowing and noise from outside didn‚Äôt sleep at all.  Told mgr in the am who didn‚Äôt seem terribly concerned, said she would discuss with co mgr and get back to me, never called back even after I phoned them again.

My husband and I stayed here for a quick anniversary weekend.  Our first we had a second story room with a nice view and balcony.  Our second night we had a room on the first floor - not as nice view but still a nice room.  Both rooms were clean and well cared for. Everyone who who works here that we dealt with were very nice and accommodating.    Would absolutely come back!

When we arrived our room was ready to go! I always love when we can check in right away. The staff was friendly, which sets the tone of your stay. I can‚Äôt tell you how important it is to have a staff that‚Äôs professional and welcoming. We were surprisingly upgraded to a room with a balcony and an ocean view. That really made our trip! The grounds have a French/beach feel. It‚Äôs so cozy and quaint.   We were in walking distance from a lot of the shops and restaurants. However, it‚Äôs about a good mile or two from the center of downtown Laguna but that wasn‚Äôt bad. The hotel is steps away from a beautiful beach which was pretty quiet. The water and scenery was gorgeous!   Two restaurants I would highly recommend for a nice yet casual dinner: The Drake (jazz music) and Mozambique (roof
Room tip: Free parking, breakfast, and flavored coffee. Beach chairs, towels, and umbrellas are available...

Summary: Ridiculous. Arrived at 1:30PM and our room was ready. They wouldn‚Äôt let us check in until 2:00 PM unless we paid a $35 early check-in fee. The room was like a small box...very claustrophobic and the duvet cover was stained and filthy. There was no fan in the shower so the mirrors fog up after showering and there is no shelf in the shower to put your soap or shampoo.  Aside from all of that, the staff was very friendly.

Summary Heading: Clean and friendly hotel right on the beach
Summary: Can't beat this location--less than a block to the beach/ocean--don't even have to cross the street.  Stayed in double room, which was not particularly large or fancy but very clean and with a view of the ocean thru the back windows.  Front desk staff was very friendly--provided tasty breakfast bags.  Free parking also a big plus.  Will stay there again when visiting Laguna Beach.

Summary Heading: I should have known there might be a problem when I saw the earplugs at the bedside!
Summary: I should have known there might be a problem when I saw that the hotel provided earplugs at the bedside!  This property is hard on the Pacific Coast Highway and surprisingly, that is not the source of much noise.  The paper thin walls allow one to hear virtually everything in adjacent rooms.  In my particular case, I could hear my neighbors watching "Two and a Half Men" at 3 AM.  I finally figured out that you could set the air conditioner to fan only (Laguna Beach cools off nicely at night), and the white noise will pretty much drown out all else. I booked this property primarily based on the high ratings I found on this site and others.  While it was not bad, its ratings far exceeded my experience.  Like anything else, there is good and bad.  Let's start with the good:

Summary Heading: Great Getaway Spot in Laguna Beach!
Summary: Great visit and stay at the Seaside Laguna Inn & Suites.  The hostess, Brie, is an incredible asset!  She does her job seamlessly.  I had a nice room with a king bed.  I thought by its description, Cozy King Bedroom,  that the room would be bigger.  I should have focused on ‚ÄúCozy‚Äù.  Anyway - here‚Äôs what worked - very clean, bed was super comfortable, TV and internet worked great.  Shower stall a bit cramped, and old school (so kind of 1950s), not the end of the world.  It had a great shower head and good pressure.  Bathroom basin had a crack in it - didn‚Äôt cause a problem, just thought it was a bit tacky.  Location is slightly south of the busy tourist area, and I like that.  Great walking, lots of beach access, and plenty of restaurants nearby.  The coffee machine in the lobby

Last week we stayed three nights at this hotel located on the beach in Laguna Beach.  We loved being able to see the ocean from our room, although our view was obscured by a partially built house that has been abandoned.  Our room had everything we needed. Super charming decor in the room, in the lobby, and on the property. The gazebo has beautiful plants and comfortable seating.  But we didn't sleep a wink due to the traffic noises from the PCH.  Earplugs were provided, but they didn't help enough.  Would not stay here again.

Had a wedding to attend to in Laguna and needed to stay close to the venue.  Seaside Laguna Inn & Suites did not disappoint.  Charming older building, but clean, and staff was really nice and friendly.  I would recommend this place.  Not posh and pretentious, but comfortable, clean and conveniently located near the beach and nearby shops and restaurants.

Me and my girlfriend stayed in one of the queen rooms with a beautiful ocean view. The room has everything you need, it‚Äôs Super clean and had really comfy bed and pillows. The staff are lovey and they have a super cool golden retriever. A great place to stay and would definitely stay there again when visiting Laguna.

My boyfriend and I were looking for a cozy place to stay right by the beach, and Seaside Laguna Inn and Suites was perfect! The service is excellent, and they make you feel right at home. We were given a bottle of wine and snacks when we got back after a long day, and also were upgraded to an ocean view room. The owner and staff are wonderful, and I highly recommend anyone to stay here if you are visiting Laguna Beach!

We needed to book a couple of nights quickly upon leaving a hotel due to noise and management issues. It was important that we find a quiet room as we had had no sleep the night before.  I called and spoke with Bri and shared what we were looking for.  It was Thanksgiving week and we had returned to Laguna to spend the holiday with family. Bri was very compassionate and upon arrival showed us the room she thought fit our needs. It was perfect. This little hotel is a gem! It is very inviting and quaint. Details in the room and in the common area show that the owners take great personal pride in their place. We felt our room was like staying in someone's guest room in a home. It was delightfully warm and cozy..... not sterile and institutional as some hotels can feel. It had a

Great location and friendly, professional staff. Short walk to the beach. great breakfast and coffee options. Worked from lobby with great wifi. Ability to rent beach chairs, boards etc. Just a few blocks from great restuarants and cheap eats. Can't be the value. Rooms while small had an efficient design and layout and the bathrooms were great. We'll be back.

the property is a bit antiquated, but the rooms are kept very clean. Scrubbed floors daily, clean linens and towels. Nice breakfast, help are really nice and friendly. Close to beach and downtown. Room overlooked the beach.

Stumbled upon this little gem October 2018 and loved so much we came back this year too. If you appreciate a home away from home vibe Seaside Laguna is your place. It‚Äôs clean + a little kitschy with its decor + plant lined walkway + breakfast area but that‚Äôs exactly why we love it. The 24hr gourmet coffee/ hot chocolate machine was my friend‚Äôs favorite thing & we also love the owners sweet golden retriever, Nunu. Pleasant & helpful staff. Beach Access down the alley way. Love this place!

My wife and I had a great stay at the Seaside Laguna Inn.  It appears to be a small family run motel with a very friendly staff including a friendly golden retriever who greets guest.  The motel and our room appear to have been recently remodeled and it was a perfect room for the 2 of us.  The room was compact, but lacked nothing.  The continental breakfast was bigger and more complete than usual with a nice breakfast room including an outdoor patio.  The owners have lots of greenery and our room even had an orchid plant growing.  The motel is beachside on PCH, but we didn't hear any street noise at all.  It's a half block walk to a beach overlook and stairs down to the water, and a perfect place to watch surfers and beautiful sunsets.  We loved the Seaside Laguna and hope to

Summary Heading: Nice boutique hotel close to the beach
Summary: We enjoyed a lot this nice and familiar place. Girls in receptions are very kind and they don‚Äôt hesitate to help you. They have a sweet dog üê∂. The beach is pretty close. They gave us the room with the view without extra charge. It‚Äôs possible to rent the umbrella for the beach. Finally we had breakfast in hotel in USA. The room was comfortable and it had the typical beach-house interior design. It seemed to be at home.

Our basic queen-bed room had western windows that let us hear the surf at night.  PCH was not a problem because of the dual-pane eastern windows. Comfortable bed.  Adequate continental breakfast.  The shower is tiny but hot. Nice walk on nearby Agate Beach, down the steep staircase.  The most economical choice on the west side of PCH in the summer.

This was my fianc√© and I's first time staying here, and we will be back! For the past 25-30 years, my family and I have been coming to Laguna. They (and me as a child/teen) have stayed at the Capri Laguna (which they still do). but my fianc√© and I were looking for somewhere close, and not as expensive as the Capri. We stumbled on Seaside through booking,com, and I am so glad we did!  Laguna is such a popular city nowadays, especially in the summer months. We were able to secure this hotel for August, 5 nights, under $1500, with an ocean view!   Staff is extremely friendly (especially Alexis), rooms are clean, they always have snacks and a continental breakfast in the morning available, and you are only steps away from the beach.   Best part is they allow dogs! We had such a

Room was comfortable and clean. Had a microwave and small refrigerator, small table. The bed was very very comfortable! The bathroom was large and modern. The location is fantastic. Continental breakfast and snacks throughout the day provided in the lobby.  No pool. But that‚Äôs ok as the beach is less than a 5 minute walk.

Unfortunately, received bad news today about my reservation I made in December and confirmed in May of this year, they gave my room to a higher bidder.  Got a good rate in December and confirmed my good rate in May and all was well, till today. Getting the feeling business owners are getting desperate in California these days, maybe impacting the small hotels or like this one, a motel.

Cute old hotel, great greeting staff (including Nu Nu the dog), cozy rooms with beach view from second floor. Free parking and breakfast with great coffee machine. Best keep in mine building is very old and has its quirks but to me that just adds to the charm.

Seaside Laguna Inn was a wonderful find and great value for our visit to Laguna Beach. The room was up-to-date, clean, and enjoyed the sound of the waves. We enjoyed our patio watching the sun go down. We found the ocean sound quite soothing and kept our screen open all night, but if you want it quieter, there are white noise devices available at the front desk. When we checked in the lounge area had cookies, snacks, fruit, newspapers, a large tv, and coffee maker for you. They also had tea available. For breakfast the next morning hard-boiled eggs, bagels, cream cheese, fruit, yogurt, oatmeal, and more was available in the lounge. Overall we cannot recommend this establishment enough. Rochelle was extremely helpful when we checked in, and the staff was always smiling when we
Manager Response: Thanks so much Theo, your positive feedback means so much to us! Please come back again soon :)

Summary: Room clean and spacious, arrived on my birthday and was given a complimentary bottle of bubbly. Can see the water but not fantastic views from room 200. Balcony was great to sit out on and watch the sunset
Manager Response: We're glad you had a great birthday with us, come back again soon!

Summary: This was a great find for our couple of nights stay in Laguna. The staff were delightful and the resident dog was lovely! We had a standard room which was very nicely decorated and had all the amenities you could want. If you want complete privacy you need to have a room upstairs. Our friends had a king size room which looked out onto the beach and was also lovely. The breakfast area is nice and breakfast is ok. There is tea and coffee ( and popcorn) available to help yourself all day while reception is open which is a very nice touch and the sofa in the room makes it feel very homely. There is a nice outside are as well. Great location on the bus route for the free weekend shuttle and a nice walk into town or down to the beach. Would highly recommend.

I had a wonderful stay at seaside Laguna inn! the place was wonderful the staff was wonderful can‚Äôt wait to go back again thank you very peaceful place. And loved having Nunu the golden  retriever  Dogy there every time I went for breakfast she was adorable and made my trip even more special üòä

Stayed Seaside Laguna Inn & Suites for our Anniversary. We choose a room with a king bed, balcony, kitchen and beautiful ocean view. Very private location. Really enjoyed easy access to the beach. Must be able to take lots of stairs to the beach directly from the hotel. Breakfast area very well thought out, rooms tidy & clean with beach themed decorations. Loved our view from our room. Highly recommend. Restaurants within walking distance.
Manager Response: We are so glad to hear you enjoyed spending your anniversary here at Seaside, we look forward to seeing you again in the years to come!

Summary: When I brought up an issue with the shower in room 205, the mgr accused me of not knowing how to operate a shower. I am LGBTQ, and my partner is Hispanic, and speaks Spanish fluently, asked the gentleman working below our balcony (they were maintenance men) if there were plumbing issues, and they said yes. This was brought up to the manager, who said we were lying, there is no issue with the room. When I asked her for a discount due to the fact I cud not get hot water in the shower. She said no, and told me she wud show me how to work a shower. When I voiced my dissatisfaction in her customer service skills. She threatened to call the police, both my partner, and myself. When I asked on what basis, we didn't use profanity, or threaten physical harm to the business or its
Manager Response: Dear Guest, If I may clarify, your complaint was that the hot water in the shower was not working; upon inspection it was clear the hot water worked if you turned the knob in the other direction, but you still wanted a bit of a discount for an issue that did not exist. You stated that you've worked in hospitality, so you should know as much as we do that it goes against policy and can be a headache to issue a refund for a problem that doesn't exist, espeically when the guest is throwing false accusations of racism and homophobia. Seaside Laguna welcomes everyone from all backgrounds, and we are proudly ran by a woman of color. With all due respect, you came into the lobby already using profanity and accusing our staff of lying, we do not take these type of statements lightly. We did our best to comply and sort this out, but we simply cannot give out discounts for an issue that wasn't there.  And yes, we do have cameras around the lobby capturing all that happened, including the moment you said "if you don't discount it, that's fine but all of social media will hear about this". Again, all stemming from a request for a discount over an issue that didn't exist. I apologize for the bad experience you had and I apologize you feel this way about our staff, but we did all we could to work with your wife and yourself, but the disrespect you showed our staff made it clear you had your mind made up.

Summary Heading: Great private patio, ocean view value
Summary: Amenities suffice but spa would be great. Little fixes would score big with me, such as a second bar soap for shower and a hook in bathroom for towel or clothes. I appreciate the mini fridge, microwave and coffee maker, plus breakfast/day room is better than expected.
Manager Response: Thank you for the feedback! Regarding the soap, we will keep that in mind and do our best to make sure every room is properly stocked!

Summary: My boyfriend and I stayed here on NYE, the room was super cute and the hotel itself has such a nice vibe, I loved my stay and my boyfriend didn't even have anything to complain about! Good wifi too, always a plus!

Summary Heading: Nice little hotel right on the street
Summary: Great location, right on the main street, there is no beach for swimming nearby, but the main beach and the rest of the famous places are very close, some walking distance. I liked their breakfast, its quality over quantity. There is parking available without hustle, so no worries about that. The stuff is very friendly and welcoming and they will assist you with any needs that you have. I definitely recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you so much, we appreciate your feedback and we're so so happy to hear you enjoyed your stay!

Summary: We came to Seaside Laguna Inn and suites to celebrate our first wedding anniversary.   Pros: Staff was phenomenal. Super caring and personable. They even brought us a bottle of wine because it was our anniversary! Thanks!  Location was excellent! It is truly just a few steps from the beach! We had a second floor room with a view and it was awesome!  In Laguna there is a free trolley on the weekends that takes you around the town to all the major shops and dining, etc. And Seaside Laguna Inn and Suites has a trolley stop right outside the hotel! There is plenty of restaurants in walking distance as well.  Rentals: We wanted to have a beach day and the hotel had rentals for beach towels, beach umbrellas, tents, and beach chairs reasonably priced! This was excellent for us because

Summary Heading: decent, no frills, tight room, good location
Summary: a little dinged up is the room...the shower is tiny and needs major rennovations (the shower floor) Skimpy toiletries ( no bar of soap for sink?) Location is great, trolley will take you back and forth entire PCH, right down to the main center, every 20 minutes no charge. Parking on site, at times full but usually you'll find a space. Beach is directly behind, couple blocks of steps down. Room has grea firm bed (finally) one of the nightstand lights did not work; there were only 2 nightstand lights and the one in the bathroom. Our room was small, had a fridge. Also a small tv.  Breakfast very basic and simple items. Grab n go items included granola/choc chip bars, bananas, few bags of doritos if your lucky, and scantly scattered bagels and packaged pastries in the a.m. Paid 185

We arrived at the hotel, were greeted by two young ladies and checked in. We were informed right away that it would be $40 more to be on the second floor and $60 more if we wanted a late check out. We opened the door and were greeted by a terrible smell, an old and musty smell.  They had the bathroom window open and the front window open, it was not enough.  The bathroom window was a very tall window that was NOT obscure glass AND there was no screen!  I closed the window, which face an alley, anyone could have just climbed in, and tried to turn on the AC.  I couldn't and went to the front desk for help, they were able to turn it on after figuring it out. When we returned later that night for bed I realized the bathroom window blinds did not close all the way so I had to open

We loved the patio area outside of the lobby.  It was great for our family to play cards and visit in the evening. The coffee machine at breakfast was perfect along with the choices of breakfast food. Access to the beach was great.  Having 8 in our party it was nice to be able to walk to great resturants.  Love, Love, Love this place and we will be back.

Such a pleasant stay! We had the upstairs king room #208 with an ocean view. Staff was super friendly and professional. They sent up complimentary champagne upon hearing it was our anniversary. The room was quaint and spacious. Deck was oversized and quiet. The busy Coast Hwy was drowned out by the sound of the waves as the room faced the ocean. We slept hearing the waves. Charming patio and inside area for eating breakfast. They offer a complimentary continental breakfast that was pleasant. Beautiful beach access in either side of the property and parking. In downtown area but at the edge so lots of shops and restaurants within a easy walk but not quite the crazy energy of the heart of Laguna. Free trolley very convenient. Will be back!

Summary Heading: Pros and Cons: A good deal & great location!
Summary: Summary: I stayed here with my wife and 1 year old in July. We really enjoyed the convenient location and parking, and the price is excellent considering the location. You can access the beach on both sides of the hotel easily. I would recommend Pearl Street Beach in the mornings. We stayed in the classic suite, which has a living space separated from the master bedroom by a door (important if you're traveling with kids). The living space features a sitting area (two chairs, futon, a high top bar table with two stools) with a kitchenette (microwave, sink, mini-fridge). The master bedroom features a king size bed, a large couch with a pullout, TV (TV not in living space), a mirrored changing area with two closets, full bathroom and balcony. The views from the balcony are nice but

Summary Heading: booked on hotels.com for a hotel with accesible rooms and this was 1 hotel they offered
Summary: My wife and I get to the hotel. I use a wheelchair for mobility and can't walk at all. Quad.My wife goes in to check the room and she can barely squeeze between the bed and wall to get to the bathroom. The hotel clerk tells us this is the disabled room.  I have a difficult time traveling unless I can get to the bathroom and when I get somewhere and the room isn't accessible I'm really lucky if I can find another hotel. Most have only a couple rooms and it''s amazing how many they give to people who can walk. If you're in a chair don't believe the websites,hotes.com,priceline etc unless they can give you clear access info. The real insult was the clerk said he was doing us a favor to give us a credit for our prepaid credit card payment. no offer to find another hotel for us. I

Summary Heading: Horrible don‚Äôt believe a word they say
Summary: Looking through the pictures I was worried the bed looked uncomfortable so husband asks about bed and manager says they are new beds they just need to be broken in.  Our bed was not new.  It sounded like breaking plastic every time you move.  Shower was so tiny you might feel claustrophobic.  No beach access no view from bottom floor. I am putting my review in so that I don‚Äôt get fooled by the pictures again.
Manager Response: Hi Barbara, Thank you for your recent and honest review. We appreciate you taking the time to let us kknow about your recent stay and how we can improve. We are sorry to hear that our rooms were not up to par, we definitely like to make sure our guests have the best experience while they are here, and we would've loved to learn about this during your time here with us to better accomodate you. Although we do have new mattresses in all of our rooms, we cannor guarentee that everyone will love the mattresses away from home. We  apologize if this caused any trouble during your stay. Maybe in the future, you can give us a second chance to better accomodate ou in a better room.   Best Regards.

Summary: Only a minute from the beach Nice minimalistic rooms with sea view Very friendly and helpful owner and staff Convenient parking.  Many good restaurants within walking distance.   Really recommend this - value for money!
Manager Response: Thank You JoaAlm for your feedback! We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay with us and that we were able to provide a comfortable atmosphere during yout trip! We hope we can accomodate you again during your next visit to the beautiful Laguna Beach!

Summary Heading: Seaside motel getaway at excellent price
Summary: We had two intercommunicating rooms, one of which was a suite with full separate kitchen bathroom and dressing room.  I think we got a great room at a great rate. Having read some reviews beforehand we were a bit worried but this is a friendly clean accommodation, on the seaward side of PCH with parking- a great plus- and breakfast.  Yes it‚Äôs got prepacked pastries but it had other stuff too, and it‚Äôs definitely a bonus not to go out and buy breakfast.  We loved its motel vibe and it‚Äôs really close to some excellent bars and restaurants.  Corner rooms are huge...can be a little noisy until PCH quietens down At night by highly recommend this old, but certainly not shabby inn.

Summary Heading: A Cozy Getaway Inn For Explorers
Summary: I was here for two reasons: 1) to help my daughter celebrate her 18th birthday with her friends by renting them the large family suite; and 2) quiet time for myself away from the kids for night.  Location: The Inn is right off the main drag, Pacific Coast Highway, so the sounds of cars going by throughout the night is a potential deal-breaker for light sleepers. It wasn't an issue for me and even if it were, the Inn provides ear plugs to wear at night.  Family Suite;  We had the Family Suite on the 2nd floor, which was their largest room. It had the main room with a large sofa, TV, and queen size bed. The side room had a smaller bed and access to a bathroom and kitchenette. There is also a sizable balcony that overlooks the ocean.  For a group of 6 kids, this was the ideal size
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you so much for your feedback, as it helps us to make improvesmenbts and better accomodate incomming guests during their stays with us. We are happy to hear our rooms provided adequate space for your trip and attended to your needs. We truly enjoy such a close beach location and are happy that we get to share that with our guests. Please consider us for your next vacation to Laguna Beach!

Summary Heading: Really happy that I stayed even after seeing some bad reviews! Loved it here!!!
Summary: Really happy that I stayed at the hotel even though I saw some bad reviews. I was surprised by the negative reviews because my experience was so great.  Was very well-received from the beginning, when I quickly checked in and was offered popcorn and help with my luggage. When I couldn‚Äôt get my phone WiFi to work, the staff was the friendlist and came over to connect for me. (I was just typing in the WiFi password incorrectly- it was free WiFi too!)   I was in the suite and the bed sheets in my room felt so new and clean. The room even had a large balcony that I could walk out on. I wish I could live there!

I love everything about this hotel. Especially the location. Short walk to beach, shopping and restaurant.Breakfast is complimentary. Free parking and WiFi. Just a great find. good room, cozy and adequate. lovely staff. I've stayed in few hotels but this was such good value for such great location. I'll be back and have recommended to others.

So my fianc√© and decided to get married in beautiful Laguna Beach, I made plans to stay in a boutique style hotel right by the beach. We arrive on Friday January 5th 2018 to start setting up our wedding, because for some reason no one could help us over the phone or internet. My fianc√© soon find our hotel and go to see if we could check in early, we were met by what seemed to be a really annoyed young lady at the front desk, I pushed past the annoyance and was told that I would be called when my room was ready, which really wasn‚Äôt a big deal.  So my fianc√© and I went site seeing in Laguna and tried to find a restaurant for our wedding.  As the day went on we realized it was after 3pm, our normal check-in time, so we headed to the hotel and went to check in, got the keys and
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We appreciate the time you spent sharing your experience with us and we regret to not having met your expectations. We are surprised by your comment because we've never had any complaints about our beds before. In fact, er purchased orthopedic mattresses just a couple months ago. As you say, we offered to upgrade you to a better room for no charge, at your same discount rate. We also offered to show you different room types in our boutique hotel and also extra amenities that would make you more comfortable. So we do not understand the controversy created with this comment when we have tried to adapt to your necessities as much as possible.   Kind regards,  Seaside Staff

Summary: The beach is just a few minutes walk away. It's actually almost backing a cliff down to the sea! It was quiet and clean. We loved our stay there. The breakfast could use a little more variety, but where they're not a very large hotel, I don't think it was too big a deal. I would definitely recommend this place to others.
Manager Response: Hi Daniel,   Thanks so much for your lovely review. Opinions like yours make our work and effort rewarding. As for our breakfast, we have added more light treats and are offering a variety of pastries, bars on the go, oatmeal, fruits, cookies that guests can snack on.

Summary: The bed was comfy. There I said something nice. When I arrived from being on the freeway for a few hours I needed to use the restroom. It was not yet check-in time so I asked if I could use theirs. They said no we do not have public restrooms but, they did offer me something to drink but since I was trying to do the opposite I declined. So in my opinion that was strike 1. Oh one more nice thing, they did let me use their parking lot before check-in time as parking in Laguna is tricky at times. Strike 2 is when I asked them for a second wine glass and the person at the front desk said they would try ( because I guess it's hard to do your job)to get me one. He did bring me a wine glass, however dirty, but he did bring me one. Strike three was that there was just an assortment of

Summary Heading: Meh....if there are no other options, then this will work.
Summary: Overall, this room was "ok".  We didn't splurge a lot on a room because we weren't going to be spending a lot of time in it, so I guess we got what we paid for.    We arrived at about 1pm and asked if we could check in early, we were told that room wasn't ready yet, but the kid (literally, he appeared to be 16 or so) working the front desk said he would call me when it was ready.  Fast forward 2 hours, no call from the kid, so we came back anyway because check in time was 3pm.  Our room was ready so we went inside to check it out.  The bed seemed to be a full size (and had an odd box spring that made a lot of noise)  The room wasn't much larger than the bed.    Again, we were ok with this because we weren't staying in there long and there were only two of us.  The bathroom was
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for your feedback on your experience during your stay with us.   Our standard check-in time is at 3PM for most guests if the rooms are not available for early check-in. Our employees, although looking young, can assure you in assisting you as much as possible. The room may have been towards the end of the list of rooms to clean, pushing the check in time a bit further back. Regardless, we apologize for the delay and the lack of contact prior to check in.   We are happy to say our rooms have had their mattresses and boxes replaced with orthopedic mattresses to provide guests with a more restful time. We also have other room options you are welcome to look at if rooms are available.

Summary: Staying 2 nights here. Location is very good, short walk to beach for a swim. Breakfast is complimentary and has cereals, pastries and tea and coffee. Street traffic is a little noisy as you are right on the highway. And as other people have said rooms are pretty small. Positive is free parking and wifi, and air conditioning.
Manager Response: Dear guest, we appreciate your review and would like to remind you that opinions like yours make our work and effort rewarding.

Summary Heading: Pleasant little hotel but shame about the staff
Summary: This hotel has a good location especially as a cheaper option when staying in Laguna beach. The rooms are clean but quite small. Unfortunately our holiday here was ruined because a payment for the hotel was taken three times on my credit card. I was understanding to the fact that someone had made a mistake but trying to sort it out was just impossible. The staff on reception looked like they didn't care and just weren't bothered at all. Nobody could explain to me why it had happened and only one gentleman on reception was able to help me. I wasted alot of time trying to explain the situation and in the end I had to dispute the payments with my bank and my bank sorted the problem out. I understand mistakes can happen but a friendly face and better customer service is needed!

We found it to be very clean.  Parking lot great.  Had forgotten toothbrush and were able to get one at front desk.  Coffee maker worked good.  Shower small but has an extended arm to be plenty tall enough for my 6'5" husband.  We don't hear noise from neighboring rooms.  Balcony is great.  We have sliding door open, hearing crickets and waves.  We are thinking of putting bed on balcony due to extreme noise of S Coast Highway.   It's really noisy.  Price value for location is good.  The town is great.  Walking to restaurants, riding trolley, all fun.   Would stay again.  My xanax saves the day again as we will sleep no matter if the Indy 500 keeps up all night or not! Tip: open slider. It does balance out the noise.  I'm looking forward to my early morning walk to explore the
Manager Response: Opinions like yours make our work and effort rewarding.

Summary Heading: One of the only places with AC!!
Summary: For the price, one of the only places around with air conditioning, a helpful staff, and new remodel, we give it a 4!  Ocean view, on the other hand, is just that -- you can see the ocean, but through the houses and construction in front of you first...
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback, We apologize for the ongoing construction by our neighbors! Something like that being out of our control, we can definitely try to accommodate your next stay in a room away from the site.

Summary: I was looking for a reasonable room for one night after Pageant of the Masters. This fit the bill. The room was very, very small but had everything we needed. A free trolley goes by to take people to the pageant. But, we did wait a very long time for the pickup going there.
Manager Response: Dear guest, We appreciate your review and hope to see you during the upcoming Pageant.   We tend to get extremely busy during the Pageant but would love to show you other room options if they are available. Please feel free to ask about our other accommodation possibilities in order to try to find a better suiting room for you.   Thank you for your feedback.  Kind regards, Seaside Staff

Summary: Great hotel in Laguna Beach. It is one of those gems you hope to find in ones travels. You can see and hear the ocean from your room. The rooms are super clean and well decorated. Jocelyn and the rest of the check in staff are the best in the business. I'll definitely be staying there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, Dave. We are extremely pleased that you enjoyed your stay. We have recently upgraded some aspects of our property and would love to have you back.

Summary: We stayed 1 night here. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful during check in. The room was quaint but clean. I was slightly disappointed we couldn't hear the waves from our room, but it is not right on the beach. We had a partial view of the ocean which was nice. It is a close walk to the beach and many shops and restaurants. However, Laguna is a bit hilly so if you don't like that I would drive. You can hear some faint traffic from the room. It was not bad but if you are annoyed by that the hotel does offer earplugs.
Manager Response: Thank you Genny, we appreciate your honest review. We apologize for the street noise, we realize PCH and Laguna Beach in general can get pretty busy. We would love to show you our other room options to find a room that suits you perfectly.

Summary: This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel in as many years. The price to quality ration is outstanding and just a few minutes walk to the beach! Would highly recommend everyone. The staff is very friendly and helpful and the rooms are large and comfortable.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback, Jaret. We appreciate your honesty and are proud to say we serve lovely guests such as yourself.

Summary: We loved the Seaside Laguna Inn!  We were 2 adults and stayed in a two queen room.  It was small, but very clean and the beds, linens and pillows were very comfortable.  Served our needs well and i would definitely love to stay here again.  Staff was very friendly and accommodating.  The reception room was clean and comfortable to hang out in with free coffee, fruit and pastries in the morning.  Location was perfect. just past the business of downtown but easy access, either walking or the free local trolley with stop right in front of hotel.  Would definitely recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback, Cindy. We are pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay with us and would be happy to help you find a room more suitable for your next stay with us.

Summary: What a fabulous choice we made to stay here.totally exceeded our expectations.Pleasant check in and earlier than had hoped for.First floor king with seaside and balcony.Also had adjoining room with other family members which was great and unexpected.The room was large clean and comfortable.Breakfast was included and a nice added bonus.Minutes from the beach.Would definitely recommend and would stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, Sue. We are glad you enjoyed your stay with us. We also have rooms with full ocean views on our second floor, some adjoining as well, to better fit your family and provide you a more relaxing experience on your next trip to Laguna Beach.

Summary: We stayed here from June 21 to 24, 2017. We booked two rooms, one of which we expected to accommodate our three young adult children. The website said that we would be able to add a rollaway bed to the room, which already had a king sized bed in it. Alas, when we arrived, there was no rollaway available and one was promised for the second night. That didn't happen either, as the other guests apparently didn't return the rollaway as expected. Maybe the hotel only has one?! So, needless to say, don't count on sleeping more in a room than the number of actual beds can accommodate. The room with the king was actually a decently sized room. The other room that we rented had a queen sized bed and there was only room for that queen sized bed and a small table in the room. It was super
Manager Response: Dear Michelle, Thank you for taking the time to give us feedback about your stay.   We apologize for the inconvenience the rollaway situation may have caused. We try to accommodate our guests to the best of our abilities, but it may get difficult during summer due to higher volumes of guests staying with us. If available, we would like to offer you a look into one of our suites which is suitable for up to 4 guests each, with plenty of space for everyone.   Our staff prides itself in trying to meet the needs of every guest and keeping each room as comfortable as possible.

Summary: We stayed here on 29th may and we left with a mixed review. The room was tidy and well set out although the bathroom was tired and in need of an upgrade. The bed was comfy but the noise at night was unbearable. There is no double glazing and the door is made of thin wood so at points it felt we were sleeping on the main road. That being said the location is great 3 minute walk to the beech and loads of parking.
Manager Response: Dear Matt,  Thank you for your review, we appreciate you taking the time to write it.  We are pleased to say that our rooms have undergone some remodeling and are now comfier with new mattresses as well as new decor. We would also like to remind you that we offer free ear plugs for any guest who may need them. We also offer rooms on the second floor with ocean views, to put you a little further from the road noise, as well as a better way to hear the waves at anytime of the day.

Summary Heading: 2 Star tired motel which promises but does not deliver
Summary: We stayed for two nights on our PCH trip south, we had booked an ocean view king room. The motel is situated about a mile from the main Laguna beach area but that's not a problem because there's a free trolley bus which runs every 20 minutes up until 8 pm . On arrival the girl on reception was friendly enough, our room was on the first floor. Yes you can see the ocean ( and hear it) but it's an obstructed view with some houses in front, yes you have a balcony with the cheapest of plastic chairs on there. The room was very tired and a bit grubby, it had seen better days ( 30 years ago) and needs a refurbish. The bedding smelt funny and although the bed was comfortable enough I dread to think what the standard rooms are like. They offer free breakfast which consists of a coffee

For the upgraded Ocean View King Suite.... I expected more than the "view" I had. A half rebuilt home blocked all but a 5' view. Every sunset was blocked by a homes air conditioner unit. Tiny plastic beach chairs on the balcony did not give any view as I had to look through the wood railings to get any ocean view. If they were more like bar stools... it would be a better view. As for the sunset... I literally stood on the chair to get the actual picture of the sunset not fully blocked by the air conditioner on the roof. I begged my husband for a hotel room DIRECTLY on the beach. This is NOT directly on the beach in any way shape or form. Close, but not that close.   As for the room itself, there were only 3 sockets available... and NONE near the bed/table. There was one near the
Manager Response: Dear Raquel, On behalf of the Seaside Laguna Inn and Suites Staff, i want to apologize for any misleading information you might have received of our rooms being directly on the beach or having full ocean views. As you saw, we are not directly on the beach but steps away, we also do not half full ocean view rooms we have partial view rooms of the sea and all other issues we sincerely apologies. I will refer these issues to the right department to take care of them and we hope you give us a second opportunity to improve ourselves. Best Regards!

Summary: Stayed a few days at Seaside Laguna Inn and we had a relaxing time!  Why my rating isn‚Äôt higher: -We were cautious about booking the place because other reviews said the bathroom wasn‚Äôt well-kept and the shower didn‚Äôt drain, but we didn‚Äôt have any problems with that. Everything worked fine for us but the bathroom was a bit small compared to the rest of the room. -Walls were a bit thin and I could hear some car noise outside, but the front desk was so nice about it and even offered me ear plugs!  Why my rating isn‚Äôt lower: -Really friendly customer service. Huge plus for me! -Spacious room with ocean view. Our room didn‚Äôt have a view for the entire beach shore, but having the outdoor terrace to watch the sunset was beautiful -Good wifi -Steps from the beach -Easy access to all
Manager Response: Dear Ayushi,  I want to thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us and many others who are looking to book our hotel for future stays. We are very pleased to hear you enjoyed your recent stay with us. Unfortunately, the structure of the building is years old and we try to maintain it and keep it in great condition. I am very happy to learn our staff was more then accommodating and helpful to your needs. We hope to see you in the near future once again. Best Regards!

Summary: Would definitely stay again!  We didn‚Äôt get an ocean-view room on the upper floor. Our lower level room wasn‚Äôt huge, but there was enough space to comfortable lounge around. We also loved the fact that the room came with two queen beds that actually felt bigger, like king-sized beds.   The beach was also right behind the inn, a few steps away, so it was incredibly easy to enjoy the sun and water.
Manager Response: Dear Samantha,  Thank you for your feedback. We are incredibly happy to learn you had an enjoyable stay and most definitely returning. We cant wait to see you in the near future. Best Regards.

Summary: Comfy and pleasant stay. Great price for the value! I stayed for the weekend with my boyfriend and couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better experience!  PROS:We were in one of the upper floor rooms, so we had a nice balcony with stone tiles where we could enjoy watching the sun set over the horizon. The room was very cozily decorated with comfortable sheets. Though the bathroom space was a bit small, it was very clean when we checked in.   I've read reviews that the customer service isn't great, but perhaps they've hired new people because the service for us was extremely accommodating. We were allowed to park our car for free and even for the whole day on our check-out day, allowing us time to walk around and explore more of Laguna without worrying about parking meters. The free wifi
Manager Response: Dear Olivia, We are happy to hear you had an enjoyable experience and had lots of fun during your visit to Laguna Beach. It's always nice to know when our guests are having an amazing time wondering the city and its beautiful sites. Everyone has their own experiences and we are always open to hearing from all our guests. This way we as a business know what improvements to make and in what areas. We would love to welcome you back in the near future on your next trip out to Laguna Beach. Kind Regards,  Seaside Laguna Inn and Suites Management

Summary: Room had a little fridge which came in handy. Bed was good size. I did tend to wake up quite early despite not wanting to but I'm not sure whether the quality of the bed had anything to do with that. The room also had a little table with two simple chairs, a night stand on either side of the bed and a little cabinet with drawers which had a little coffee maker on it. There was a TV which we did not try out ourselves.  Bathroom is small but has everything I would need, a toilet, a wash basin and a shower "cubicle". The shower cubicle is small yet large enough to have a proper shower. Water pressure is good and temperature can be adjusted and is also good. Shower head is unfortunately fixed.  The upper level rooms have a good sized balcony with a view on the ocean. There is no
Manager Response: Hi,  Thank you so much for taking the time to leave us your feedback. I am so glad you enjoyed your stay here with us regardless of the small disadvantages you found. We hope to see you back in the near future and you can experience another pleasant stay. Best Regards.

Summary Heading: we must have gotten the good room it was huge..
Summary: We had the top corner family room .. it was so large you could live in it. two rooms and large bathroom two couches and a king size bed. 55inch flat screen TV and the outside deck was large enough to have a full table and chair set and two beach chairs with room to walk around  with a view of the ocean; a million dollar view... only complaints: no microwave in our room despite advertisement, no vending machines on premises, continental breakfast was lacking. that being said....location, location, location at a great price!
Manager Response: Dear Melissa, Thank you for your feedback we appreciate you taking the time to let us know what we can improve on. I am pleased to know you had a wonderful stay and i want to let you know we are working hard to update the websites information to the most accurate one. I agree sometimes its misleading to see something and get to your room and not have it. I appreciate your business. We hope to see you back again. Best Regards.

Summary: For the price the rooms were pretty decent. The location was great, on the beach. The size of the room was a little small & hard to get around in some areas but the bathroom was bigger comparing to the room. The rooms were also cleaned well, I wasn't grossed out. If they tell you free breakfast it's true but don't expect a continental.
Manager Response: Hi, Thank you for your feedback, were glad you had a pleasant stay and i hope to see you back in the near future.

Summary: We were looking for a place to spend 1 night after driving in from San Diego, and for the price, we picked Seaside Inn. It was okay. Bed, sheets and towels were all clean. it's a small room with a pretty noisy AC unit. Luckily we didn't need it on. It has all the basics for one might but I wouldn't want to stay longer. It was quite noisy as the room we had was about 4 rooms down from the Office. The street noise was quite loud. Also, we could hear people walking by and talking once we woke up.It was handy to have a fridge in the room with a coffee machine.  The one BIG negative for us that was the wifi didn't work well in our room. We had to stand near the door of the room to connect. The signal was not strong, and the only good connection we had was going into the "breakfast
Manager Response: dear Jillian,  Thank you for your feedback it is always good to have our guests share their experiences as it helps us know what needs improvement and what we are doing great on as well. I want to apologize for any inconvenience you may have had through out your stay. We are working hard to fix all general issues as well as fix larger issues with rooms and property to enhance the experience of our guests. Again, thank you for taking the time to leave us some comments and we really hope to see you in the near future again.  Best Regards.

Summary: I am really upset. I booked a family room on the Seaside Laguna website (not an outside party) and received a Booking #. All was good until today, I called to ask about room size and she couldn't find reservation. The conversation declined when she said she did not have a room for me and that I was probably put on a WAITING list, but it did not show up in her system ! I told her I did not receive any email noting that I did not have a room secure and she rudely explained that they don't send confirmations that rooms are not available. I asked if people show up and have no room available and she said: Yes, it does happen. I again asked, Does this mean I could have shown up next week and no room would be available? And she said: Yes, you are on a waiting list. I let her know I
Manager Response: We are so sorry about the situation, anyway that we can do to help You next time in town please let us know by mention this letter, we will offer you a special discount of 15% off your confirmed rate. SC

Summary Heading: Dont stay here this place stinks!!!
Summary: The room was filthy, the walls look as if they haven't been painted in years, the baseboards and door jams where chipped and dirty. The room smelled of cheap pine cleaner, after the pine smell went away all we could smell was urine. the bathroom wall next to the toilet had what look like someone had vomited and it splashed all over the wall and never cleaned.  I opened the closet to put our stuff away, it also smelled old and was filthy, the top shelf had a thick layer of dust and what looked like to be mice droppings.  Booked on line, pictures are deceiving...  Stay clear of this place!
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. I want to apologize for the inconvenience and not meeting your standards. We take all our guests feedback seriously and i want to reassure you we are working hard on making improvements. Again, my sincere apologies and we hope you are willing to give us another chance. Best Regards

Summary: Could not have been more disappointed with this hotel and its management.  My family of 4 booked a room for one night to stay over after watching Pageant of the Masters.  I booked with Hotels.com, and specifically and emphatically requested a room with two Queen Beds, as I always do when we travel as a family.  I make it a point not get family or junior suits because that means there is one bed and one fold-out couch which is inevitably extremely uncomfortable and I don't like to subject my kids to that when we travel.  We arrived to check in at the hotel after the show, so it was after 10:00 pm.  We had let the hotel know in advance that we would be late, so they left us a key under the mat as there was no one at the front desk that late.  Imagine our disappointment when we
Manager Response: Hi, Thank you for sharing your experience with us. I am truly sorry for the inconvenience and for the way this was handled. I hope you accept our sincerest apologies. If you ever come back to Laguna Beach I personally ask you to please advice us within a month in advance of your travel dates to make such accommodations for you. We'd be glad to assist you in providing what is supposed to be amazing service and and incredible stay. Again, I am so sorry you had to experience that and welcome you back in the near future.

Summary: I only interacted with the staff twice, but each time was pleasant.  The rooms are a little small, maybe 400 sq feet, but the price is really good for Laguna Beach.  It's really close to practically everything.  We walked all over and got to see a lot of different sites.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback and we are glad you enjoyed your stay. I hope you keep us in mind on your next visit down to Laguna Beach.

Summary: I had a wonderful stay here, the room was clean, the bed was comfortable and the staff where friendly and helpful with suggestions for dinner ect... I loved that it was so close to the water, spent my mornings down by the ocean with my coffee, just wonderful
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your feedback. We, at Seaside Laguna, strive to make every stay pleasant here in our boutique inn and suites. We hope you stay with us again on your future trips to Laguna Beach.  Thank you again, Seaside Staff

Summary: If you're after a somewhat comfortable bed and a good location in Laguna Beach, the Seaside Laguna is your okay, low budget option. You'll appreciate the rooftop-impaired view of the ocean, beautiful beaches, below-average to good nearby restaurants, the many art venues, and decent shopping. Free public transportation is available in front of the hotel. This is plus since getting around town by car is a challenge due to occasional traffic congestion, narrow lanes and streets, and limited parking. Parking at the hotel is plentiful and free.   If you're on the hunt for a well-maintained, meticulously clean environment with decor above what you might find at a swap meet, you're well-advised to look elsewhere. Those not bothered by a 60s blend of furnishings, a couple of
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your feedback. We, at Seaside Laguna, strive to make every stay pleasant here in our boutique inn and suites. Yes, we are one of the lowest priced hotels consistently here in Laguna, but we also hope that does not mean lower standards. This a small hotel built in the late 1950's that has been recently renovated. Every room has been newly painted and furnished so, we do hope you stay with us again on your future trips to Laguna Beach.  Thank you again, Seaside Staff

Summary: Hi guys, I stayed at Seaside during my California in the Road tour with my wife. We have choosen this hotel for the position (next to a wonderful Woods Cove beach and also a 20 mins walking to the main Beach and so to the center). The guys of the hotel are very nice. In the morning there is a fantastic hall where you can have breakfast. The rooms are clean and good size. If you will be at Laguna Beach try this Seaside!!enjoyyy!!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your feedback, we are always glad to hear that our guests felt the comfort of home at our hotel. We, at Seaside Laguna, strive to make every stay pleasant here in our boutique inn and suites. We hope you stay with us again on your future trips to Laguna Beach.  Thank you again, Seaside Staff

Summary: We stayed here for one night in late August 2016. Our room was well appointed and very clean.  The bathroom was in really good shape and I really enjoyed the tiled stand-up shower.  The sink area had not counterspace but there was a shelf below it.  The room had a balcony overlooking the water.  Unfortunately there was some construction going on at the house immediately below the window which distracted just a little from the view.  The noice from the PCH was not evident when the front windows were closed.  We left the bathroom window open and just closed the door to it.  In the back we left the patio door open so we could hear the waves at night.  This place is about 1 mile south of the center of town.  We were able to walk down to the beach and walk the beach all the way to
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your feedback. It is difficult in Laguna Beach to have the perfect setting. Being that this hotel was built in the late 1950's we do try to accommodate as best we can with PCH and houses surrounding us. We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay at our boutique inn and suites. We hope you stay with us again on your future trips to Laguna Beach.  Thank you again, Seaside Staff

Summary: Our room was small, but we used it only for sleeping.  Great location for beach, shopping, strolling down the shops and restaurants.  Wifi could be better.  Free coffee and juice all day.  Nice management and employees.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your feedback. We, at Seaside Laguna, strive to make every stay pleasant here in our boutique inn and suites. Being that is hotel was built in the late 1950's each room varies in size and looks, so we hope you stay with us again on your future trips to Laguna Beach, see our other options.  Thank you again, Seaside Staff

Summary Heading: Worst hotel I've ever stayed in and ridiculously overpriced
Summary: Honestly I've never seen anything as old and cheap as this hotel. I paid 210 for a corner upstairs ocean view room off booking.com. The pictures DO NOT REFLECT the actual condition of the rooms. The outside is just ok but the inside is horrid. The walls look like they glued them on. The rooms are very small, the bathroom old and and accessories are plastic and cheap.   There were 2 decent features.  AC and the bed was mediocre comfortable. The balcony was just ok and looked over one nice home to the left and one construction site to right over the ocean.   Breakfast was pastries coffee and juice.   I mentioned the condition of the room the the person on duty at the front desk and his reply was that they had told the owner multiple times that the rooms need updating to no avail.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your feedback. We, at Seaside Laguna, strive to make every stay pleasant here in our boutique inn and suites. I am sorry that we were not able to meet your standards for your stay. We have been under new management here since your last stay, and we have had continuous renovations. I do want to inform you we do not have a room 201 at our hotel. Also the rooms vary in size due  to the age and original construction of the hotel in the 1950's. We do hope you stay with us again on your future trips to Laguna Beach and that we are able to impress you with our changes.  Thank you again, Seaside Staff

Summary Heading: Let's look at the pro's and con's of this property
Summary: Pro's- Balcony on the 2nd floor with a partial ocean view- great to relax and enjoy a drink Location- 20 minute walk to the main beach and downtown past multiple shops and restaurants with a trolley stop right outside the entrance Listening to the surf as we slept The rate I got through Bookings.com Con's- Room was not the cleanest it should be and was somewhat dated Despite having the 2nd floor slider open all night facing the ocean- the room was stuffy and warm- I choose not to run the AC so we could hear the surf The mattress needs replacement Could not believe the coffee/breakfast room didn't open until 8:00 a.m.- unheard of in a hotel- would have made my own in the room but the coffee pot was missing Asked for a brochure and they informed me they don't have one-really?
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your feedback. We, at Seaside Laguna, strive to make every stay pleasant here in our boutique inn and suites. We are constantly updating and renovating our hotel, we are also pleased to provide anything absent from your room at any time. Our office hours are 8:00am to 11:00pm, you will notice most boutique hotels follow a similar schedule. We do not have brochures at this time but we do have business cards and regularly update brochures of surrounding shops, restaurants, activities in the area. We hope you will consider us on your future trips to Laguna Beach.  Thank you again, Seaside Staff

Summary Heading: Needs Focus on Cleanliness and Maintenance Issues
Summary: I have stayed here twice and the location is excellent.  Once, when it was pretty decent and again a little over one year later after things started looking tired and neglected.  It surprised me the change in such a short period of time.  I don't think anyone is supervising housekeeping or maintenance because the top of the shower had quite a bit of mold.  The white towels had some stains on them.  The screen door to the back deck was falling off,  Cable TV only worked sporadically.  Additionally, the two people I encountered in the front office were not too friendly or accommodating - they might have been the owners (and family).  It might be time for the owners to do a walk of the property and pay attention to the details.

The location was great. Walking distance to the beach was minutes. The room was comfortable with an ocean view. The price was right for the stay we had and we will return again. The owner cared about keeping the customer satisfied.

I've traveled to Laguna Beach for 6 years. The past 5, I have stayed here. While there may be a mix of reviews on this website, I for one, did not experience many of the issues raised in this forum. This motel is down PCH from the heart of town, but is a simple trolly ride or walk. The rooms are quaint and suitable for travel. If you are looking for comfort creatures or high end amenities, this isn't the place for you. The balconies on the second level are nice and give a partial view of the ocean. The walk to the beach is great. The beds were fine. The only downside is that the hotel is older, so the walls are thiner. You can sometimes hear traffic from road. Also, the WiFi was non-existent for most of the week we were here. They definitely need to upgrade that. Otherwise, we

The place could be good if they put some money back in but they don't... so it really is borderline dump, when it could be great. So our experience was not good, after having to switch rooms because of plumbing issues which are a big problem there, they offered us 20% off. I guess it was to shut us up because at check out new person at desk new nothing about it and we only got 10%. And we weren't the only ones. Also on day two a guest actually called the police on the guy working. (don't know what it was about). The worst part they never responded to my e-mail. Im a frequent visitor to laguna and most places are good. I would never stay here again.

Summary Heading: Beyond the WORST place I have ever stayed.
Summary: We booked a double queen room after checking in we arrived at our room to find one double sized better apparently the other rooms were flooded a few weeks ago.  We were not able to unlock our door without the both of us literally barging the door down.  The tap in the shower did not work but when it finally did the water was steaming hot.  The fridge made a noise like a flock of pigeons were going to fly out of it.   No internal locks - dangerous power pints.  Paper thin walls all night I could here the man next door snoring.  It was horrible here!  Photos are nothing like the actually hotel!

Summary Heading: Read the 3 and 4 star reviews and you will know what to expect
Summary: The place was clean. The location was good. It was easy to take the free trolley or walk to the center of town (1.2 miles away). The bed was comfortable and the linens allowed you to sleep with just a sheet. (It was warm for Laguna). Plenty of hot water. The WiFi worked fine, although we were close to the office, downstairs, which helped. The price was good for Laguna ($145/midweek night on booking.com, including all taxes and fees). We had a downstairs room. If you are big or heavy, you won't like the small shower. We should have sprung for a more spacious, upstairs room. No matter what, you will hear outside noises. We drove from home and brought a fan along and that allowed us to close the windows and still get air. We slept fine. There's a fridge in every room and there is a

Booked for week of June 25th through july 1st. We arrived at about 3:30 pm and were given a room on the second floor. when we entered we were appalled at the room, the furniture, the bathroom and the chairs on the patio. After 5 minutes we went back down stairs and asked if they had any other room in better condition than the one we were given. He seemed very surprised at our request and said no. we then asked if we could get out of the agreement because what we assumed we were getting, because of what was posted on the internet. This was false advertisement. Luckily the Best Western Plus across the street was able to accommodate us for the week. When asked why we didn't make reservations prior and we gave them our plight the managers' answer was " it happens several times." I'm

This is our third time staying at  Seaside we always feel at home here. The customer service is great and it's the best deal in Laguna Beach. Owners all always helpful and kind. We will be back next month.

Summary Heading: If it wasn't for the little things
Summary: Let me start by saying that overal it's a good hotel.   The room serves the purpose for spending most of the day outside. It is very clean and the maid does a great job in keeping the room clean!The view from the room and the location are excellent!!  There is a fridge to store some small items. A decent size closet to store your stuff. A/C and tv.  Suffisient parking space on the hotel property.  Having said that, lets talk about the minor things. Main item, wifi. In room 101 the reception is poor to non existant. Manager Joseph, who uses the word sir once or twice per sentence, gives you the feeling that you are not welcome and that you inconvenience him when asking a question. He did offer another room closer to the router but we liked the room we had so it was off to the

I visit my daughter in Laguna Beach and need a place to sleep.  Seaside was running a special DEAL of half off normal rates @$100/nite in the middle of the week and I was drawn to the savings.  This is not the Biltmore, but it is a good one and/or two star hotel.  My room was clean, had good windows to keep out the noise of the highway and had good parking.  Bottom line, yes, I would book another stay.    Since it is just feet from the beach, I think summer time prices will be a bit more expensive.  Also, Laguna has the freebie shuttle on PCH to take you down town.  Downtown parking of cars is impossible.  BUT, BUT, BUT....My daughter in another room was startled at 1100pm, when a non-identified person attempted to enter her room.  Luckily, she had used the 3 inch door stop

I would highly recommend this hotel  The rooms and property were very clean and comfortable.  The staff were great, friendly and very accomodating.  I returned for two additional nights at the hotel because of the wonderful service and accomodations.  The  hotel is simple but nicely decorated.  I plan on returning to this hotel when I return to California later this year.  The best hotel that I have stayed at in quite some time.

Chose this hotel based on satisfaction of prior stay of family members and the close proximity to our family members living in Laguna Beach.  Rooms simple and clean, comfy beds, office staff Saul and Joseph very friendly, and housekeeping does a nice job. Problems with wi-fi.  Stayed 2 weeks, and last two nights were given an upgrade to compensate for lack of wi-fi.  Room prices are reasonable.  Will stay here again on next trip to Laguna Beach.

We stayed here during the week. We had a great time. Stff was friendly, hotel was clean and the manager joeseph gave an upgrade because he saw it was celebration we put in our reservation. we greatly apprecaite that. We will be back.

Summary Heading: BIG SCAM ON THE FINAL PRICE
Summary: I have a Confirmation with exact TOTAL PRICE the SEASIDE Hotel was going to charge me and in the very end they Jacked the Price up $35 with some bogus utility Fee which was at NO TIME ever written or mentioned......  They must do this to everyone and I am going to do my best to WARN PPL so they do not get ripped off too. PLUS the Hotel's Beds are the worst and the Internet will not work. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!  TRUST ME.

Gotta say I really enjoyed my stay at Seaside! The rooms are very clean. Beds are comfortable.. Free parking and WiFi. Joseph did us a solid and upgraded our room to ocean view!! Thank you Joseph! You guys made our stay well worth our while and we will be coming back!  To keep in mind: Standard rooms are all on the main floor level, (road level) can be noisy and I don't personally like the first floor.. Ever.. Much more allergens if you are allergic.  It is well worth upgrading to oceanview rooms as they have a good ocean view.. True you see rooftops but its still ocean view.. And I would rather that than looking onto a road or anything else.  The only con I would mention is that the showers are dated and musty.. So if you have allergies as I do.. That may bother you. Just make
Manager Response: Greetings, Thank you so much for your feedback Danny F. It was a pleasure having you stay with us. We're glad you enjoyed the upgrade and we hope to see you stay with us again soon.

Summary Heading: Cute little place but not exactly "sea side"
Summary: Look carefully at the pictures and you'll see that it's more of a roof top and water view than a beach view, which I was mostly expecting but I can see how a quick glance at the pictures may have confused some prior guests.  We had a two-ish bedroom and it was big enough for all of us.  No complaints we slept well and the check in/out staff was friendly.  The walk to the beach is quick which is a huge plus.
Manager Response: Hello, Thank you for your feedback. We're always looking to hear back from guests to know what improvements to make for our hotel.

Summary: We really enjoyed our stay and will be back to stay here again. This hotel was a nice play to stay at for couples. Soothing at night to be able to hear the ocean waves.There's a lot of local restaurants in the area. You can't miss it. A bit cold but. no bother.
Manager Response: Hello, Thank you very much for your feedback. We hope you stay with us again soon.

Summary: We arrived at the seaside Laguna inn to find our ground floor room smelling like a  combo of bathroom  and Las Vegas casino. As the hotel suggested, we upgraded the room to another one upstairs that was $70 more. Everything looked fine except the wifi was not working anywhere on the property.   We arrived at the seaside Laguna inn to find our ground floor room smelling like a  combo of bathroom  and Las Vegas casino. As the hotel suggested, we upgraded the room to another one upstairs that was $70 more. Everything looked fine except the wifi was not working anywhere on the property. Around 9 pm the room started to cool off. I asked if they can fix the heater in the room. The room had no heater or AC . They brought us a portable one that did not work. We asked them to get us a
Manager Response: Dear Ms. Fakhruddinova, Thank you for taking the time to express your experience during your stay at our hotel. We appreciate hearing from our guests, as your comments and feedback are important for us to continue to improve our accommodations. I would like to apologize for our rooms not meeting your criteria. We are currently undergoing with changes to our rooms and property to make our guests stay as comfortable as possible. We always want the best for our guests. We extended our apologies out to you during the time of reporting the situation to us and had given you a courtesy refund of your full stay due to the inconvenience at which you decided to stay at another property. Unfortunately, once a room is vacated, the room must remain vacated. We had also given you an extensive time frame to vacate the room. We hope everything worked out for the best for you either way. Once again, thank you for choosing to stay with us and have a great day.

Summary Heading: Not as nice as the photos
Summary: This hotel is ok if you need a very practical overnight stop. I wouldnt plan on staying in the room very much. It's very small. A Mini fridge was available sitting on a nightstand.The bathroom was renovated and tho small it was clean. Shampoo was provided but nothing else. I had to ask for soap. The Wi-fi never worked despite our complaints to the front desk. The continental breakfast was pretty minimal. It was ok, but nothing to write home about. Close to beach. The upgraded balcony provided a look at the sea, but over an alley and some houses.The location is great though.  The first hotel staff to greet us was distracted and not that inviting. The second was not helpful. The third was quite nice.

The breakfast included is a joke. Breakfast starts at 7:30am and 7:55 is already over. Wi-fi doesn't work at all. Hotel room is extremely small and dirty with bathroom that doesn't fit more than one person at the time. The only good thing about this place is ocean view in upgraded room. In general is completely not worth it.

Great location, walking distance of beach, shops, and restaurants. Adorable inn and rooms, perfect for a weekend at the beach. Staff were friendly, didn't need for anything during the stay. Would definitely return!

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel with a Reasonable Price
Summary: Seaside Inn is a small hotel just off the beach that is affordable and clean.  The staff is accommodating and friendly.  We have stayed in room 209 four times now and love it each time.  A quick walk to the beach or to downtown restaurants make this hotel the perfect location for us.

Summary Heading: For a beach hotel, is quite ok.
