Summary: I checked in for 3 nights with my sister and my twin boys (4yrs old) Double queen bedroom. The room was ok. No view at all for me but didn't expect one. Clean but tight. Comfortable and clean beds. Bathroom ok, walk in shower needs to be refurbish. (urgently please) No closet or cupboard to hang clothes. Just a shelve with 2 hangers. Nice small refrigerator to keep fresh snacks and drinks. No coffee maker. Free Wi-Fi didn't work at all. They said they had a problem but was not resolved within my 4 days stay. During summer season, check ins are at 15/15:30 and not at 14:00 like noted in Booking.com. My room was not ready at 14:00 and I was ask to come back later but I was able to leave the car in their CONVENIENT FREE parking lot while going to the beach. Easy access to the

You can see the ocean but you have to walk to a beach. Our room was fine, wall unit a/c. They offer coffee and prepackaged pastries in the lobby each morning. The people that worked there were very friendly and helpful. It was a pleasant stay. It's hard to find fault this close to paradise.

Stayed in the Queen View room with my sweetheart; a pal came along.  The room was clean, the help was friendly.  Trolley stops, Koffee Klatch, Organic Yogurt shop, nice beach around the corner and just a bit off the ROAR of downtown.  Amenities - like GOOD coffee, non-existent; the pastries - not worth eating.  But, I get it - there are lots of great food choices in Laguna, so why bother?  I plan on returning.

Summary Heading: What I expected from this hotel
Summary: This hotel is clean, and fairly good value considering the going price for the area. We didnt reveive breakfast, however there was no shortage of places to eat in the town. The beds were brilliantly comfortable.   When I was in the bathroom on the ground floor I realised the windows werent frosted and men outside could see in! Watch out for this when yoy arrive, keep the curtains closed.   The staff were very friendly and they gave us advice on what to do and where to eat in the area, which paid off as the places they advised were good.  I would stay again.

The hotel is between the highway and the ocean with an easy access to a lovely nice beach not crowded as the one that is in the center of the town. The hotel is located just outside the centre but there are regular bus any 15 minutes going and coming. I was lucky so I had a room with a sea view but even though there is some vegetation that don't allow a great view. But if you go to the steps that make you reach the beach just around the corner of the hotel you will have a magical and peaceful view. The room are dated average clean but need to be revamped and tiny as tiny is also the bathroom. Very average room for one or two night is ok, the price is good comparing the other hotel in Laguna beach.

We stayed for 5 nights in the queen view room with a 2 year old toddler. We were looking for something affordable within a block to the beach and this fit the bill. Our room was small, very simple, but  gave us room for our luggage and pack and play. The room was somewhat updated as was the bathroom (minus toilets and shower). The deck on the queen view room was huge! But sadly there was no outdoor furniture set-up, so we requested chairs and literally got two wooden dining chairs. The location is fantastic, literally a 15 minute walk to the main downtown Laguna, but also within a block or two of great restaurants, coffee and bars. The beaches in the area are all kind of coves with beach access every quarter block so very easy to get on and off of. The beach immediately behind

This hotel is reasonably priced for the area.  The room was clean and it had everything we needed, but nothing more.  The bed was comfortable and we slept well.  I don't know what people are talking about when they say it isn't near the beach ‚Äì leave your room and walk down Agate Street, 60 seconds later you are walking down the steps to the beach.  There is a good choice of good restaurants within easy walking distance, in fact you can walk right into the centre of Laguna Beach in 15 minutes.

Pros - good location, right near Agate St Beach..short walk down the hill. Price is right, and room was clean with new mattress and tv. Cons - we were in a standard queen room that made my tiny hotel room in Rome look huge. Really really small! The bathroom is tiny and can use remodeling - it was a sign saying not to put toilet paper tampons or Sanitary napkins in the toilet because of the plumbing..toilet paper?! What the! Also in-room Wifi never would connect.  We were not planning to be in the room much.

We stayed here over the 4th of July and the rooms are clean. They were very helpful when trying to accommodate our need for a larger room when availability was low. The short walk to the beach was nice too. The beach in front of this property is surfing. Swimming is a short walk less than 1/4 mile north.  Great waves!!!!

Its right on the beach but its an old place remodeled, a little over priced but what isn't in laguna beach. If you have teenagers its worth the stay, they can walk to beach,  shops and restaurants by themselves

Summary Heading: Worst first experience at a hotel. Avoid this property.
Summary: Do not go here unless you want to stay at a motel. There is rust coming out of the walls. Back in March the 5th i checked in to my room. I saw the pictures online and it looked amazing. When i got there it looked like a motel that was run down and crack heads cane to live here for cheap. Dont be fooled. This cost me $180.00 dollars and i didnt even stay there. I left the property becaust one thing after another was bad with the room. I spoke with the owner of the property and he was very unprofessional and rude and refused to do even a partial credit for me. He did offer me to stay there at a discounted price in a newly renovated room but why would someone want to spend more money at a place where you already got ripped off. I wish i took pictures to show everyone. It looks like

Great little hotel, old school Laguna, walking distance  to restaurant's and shops.  Very clean, rooms a little small with hard wood floors, refrigerator and coffee maker. Rooms on the second floor have a nice sized balcony with a view if the  ocean and Catalina; all this for under $200,00 per night as I have said before "great place to stay that won't break the bank".

This hotel is in a great location. Beautiful. We had a lot of fun here. Joeseph recommended good restaurants and was professional. Tori was very helpful and kind. I will be returning to stay here again.

Summary Heading: exactly what we were looking for
Summary: Seaside Laguna Inn/Suites is not fancy but it gave us the ocean view and the sound of the rolling waves (over a few rooftops but not far away) and it was perfect for what we needed/wanted. King bed with comfy mattress and pillows (got an extra one) under $200/night, free parking, small fridge, free wifi, balcony to enjoy the sunset, and clean room. As I said, this is not a fancy place- no marble anything, small bathroom/shower stall, the window shimmied to the left and right in the bathroom but it went up, the furnishings are sparse, the chairs on the balcony do not have cushions, but to us it felt homey and was exactly what we were looking for.    The 40 steps they describe going to the ocean are just down a very short road adjacent to the property and I literally had a cove in

Summary Heading: Don't plan to book with Joseph - Rudest Front Desk
Summary: Wow. I tried booking this hotel 3 times with no success.  First time I called a person placed me on hold and hung up. Second time I called the SAME person placed me on hold and hung up. Third time is usually a charm - but NOT in this case. I inquired about a room and the price and it was like pulling teeth.  He couldn't answer a simple question - such as the rate per night. I then asked if I can book online, because it is not evident on the website - he then changed his tone and said GO TO EXPEDIA or whatever you want!  He claims to be the "manager" which is even more disappointing.  If they are rude on the phone I can only imagine how rude they are in person.

After a nice experience last year, we decided to come back to Seaside Laguna Inn this year for our annual trip to Laguna Beach. We stayed for 4 days/3 nights and had a nice experience. Our room was clean and comfortable. We had a balcony room, which made it great for "happy hours" with a glass of wine and some cheese in the evening. The views were nice, too. For the price, it's the best in the town. Nearby hotels are at least $250-$300 a night. The rooms have refrigerators, which is a big plus for bringing and buying snacks and drinks. The other remarkable selling point is the proximity to the beach- it's right down the street. Free Parking (w/ in and our privileges) rounds off the wonderful stay here.   My ONLY recommendation and note is that it does get noisy in the evening.

Summary Heading: Great calue even if it didn't have an ocean view!! BUT IT DOES!
Summary: I stayed at this place for 2 nights last week. In my opinion, it was great value. The rooms had everything I need, they were clean and comfortable. The staff is courteous and helpful. The location is perfect for my needs with everything I need within walking distance. The ocean view was great. I even saw dolphins swims by as if to welcome me upon my arrival.

Summary Heading: Hidden Gem! Best Deal on Laguna Beach!
Summary: We really enjoyed our stay! Beach is steps away, Clean Room, 2nd floor Balcony, Ocean Views, Coffee and Danish for Breakfast, Frig in Room, Housekeeping in great, Best Deal in Laguna Beach. We will be returning in the Summer. Thank you!

If spending time on the beach is what you want or enjoying some relaxation with the comforts of home, then this is the place for you.  My husband and I enjoyed staying here for a weekend. We had a corner suite with a king sized bed. Everything was perfect. The room has been freshly updated with wonderful amenities. It had a separate mini kitchen with a full size coffee pot, small refrigerator, sink and cabinets filled with the basics. Was perfect since this was a birthday celebration for me and my husband came prepared with wine, cheese, fruit and snacks. Having the kitchen and refrigerator made it convenient.  We were even able to bring back leftovers from brunch to enjoy the next day by reheating in the toaster oven. The bathroom shower was large and had good water pressure

We've been coming to Laguna for 10 years, and this was the worst lodging so far. We stayed in unit 108, only 25 yards from the office, but could not get Internet wifi. No coffee pot, parking spaces too small, minimal lighting, absurdly small bathroom with window next to toilet and alley with workers just outside window, road noise 24 hrs a day, no beach view, crappy bed - full, NOT queen. No pen or paper in room, horribly hard water - can't make lather with soap or shampoo. This place should be avoided if you want a relaxing vacation.

Summary Heading: Great location, Down a stairway to the beach!
Summary: We stayed here on our last 2 nights in LA. Easy to find, just nice to the the highway with lots of free parking space. The manager told us this property is owned by 4 chinese ladies and they bought it at a good price a couple of years ago. We were on the 2nd floor, no lift - and had a very very hard time bringing up 3 huge pieces of luggage to the room - with a couple of different stairways to navigate. Room was a little small and bathroom small too. Bathing area is very limited too. Balcony offers a great ocean view and the way to the bench is just down a stairway next to the hotel. No breakfast and the nearest place to eat breakfast requires driving.

This place is ok for a night. Rooms are a bit small, but clean. Very well placed to go on the beach, far from downtown. This explains why the parking is free !! The wifi is damn low and the breakfast doesn't exist. But enough for a one night stop. The proximity of the road is noisy.

We stayed there over Thanksgiving break, in a room with a view, and it was such a great stay! Everyone we met from the moment we walked in to the office to the when we left was very nice and friendly. Great management, great location, and great value! We will be coming back for sure.

A newly renovated, Seaside Laguna Inn & Suites offers a serene and romantic getaway. A short walk to stairs leading down to the Beach. The room was a bit on the small size but for overnight staying you don't need more. However for longer periods consider another hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Summary Heading: Good Beach Hotel...unless maybe you plan on staying inside the whole time
Summary: The hotel is pretty old.  Rooms are pretty small and basic.  The place isn't as clean as a new, Vegas hotel.  So if you plan on staying inside your room the entire time, I suggest finding a different hotel.  However, if you intend to walk about 50 steps from hotel to top of stairs leading down to beach, or walk about 50 steps to the bus stop (free bus rides around this area) to take a short ride to one of many very good restaurants or artsy establishments and spend your time doing something that you couldn't do in your own home, then consider this hotel.  The rooms were clean, but they're old.  They are nice though.  Bathrooms and bedding were nice.  TV seemed fine, though we never turned it on.  AC worked well, though we often had sliding door open to listen to ocean.  You can

Summary Heading: Owner's Don't Care- Travelers don't bother
Summary: Lots of potential but no attention to detail.  This motel only survives because it is in Laguna Beach.  This place can be described with one word....NEGLECT.  The quilt was stained. The TV was mounted without regard to easy viewing by guests.  Many of the power outlets did not work.  The towels were paper thin.  The pictures I have posted tell the story.  The common area near the office was dirty and unwelcoming.  The rate of $150/night would be less than $50/night if not near the beach and maybe less.  The management is obviously cheap and squeezing as much as they can from this property without making any improvements.  The only reason to return would be supply of rooms available. A regular traveler will see all of the flaws.  It is difficult to believe the owners don't or

Horrible.  Very basic, very shabby...  Unfriendly front desk.  Noisy, a weird crowd is wondering around, smoking, and having fun at your door steps late in the night. It was difficult to relax.     Beach towels were offered for $5 a piece (I naively thought it was a security deposit, but no! it was an actual pay for the time the towels spent with us).    I have never seen the room that basic, without any decorations or even an attempt to make it look better.  Still, we paid almost $900 for five nights - and it was not worth it!    It would've been much better to stay father from the ocean, but at least enjoy time spent in the room.

Summary Heading: Fall asleep to the sound of the surf
Summary: We stayed  here for a night when in Laguna Beach for the Pageant of the Masters. The hotel staff were very pleasant and even allowed us to keep our car parked there a few extra hours the next day so we could enjoy the beach just down the steps off the street just south of the hotel. ( also worth visiting). We had an upstairs room with a patio that looked out to the water. It was a peaceful spot to enjoy of coffee in the morning. The room was clean although small.  Comfortable bed and a fridge in room for drinks and snacks. Stayed only one night but wished we had booked two. The city of Laguna Beach offers free trolley service in the summer which can easily get you where you want to go without fussing with parking

I was pleasantly surprised with this property and location.  Our first day, after a 2 hour drive and 3 hour flight, we arrived shortly after 10:00 a.m.  I was greeted by Majid and he told me check in was at 3pm, however, we could go ahead and do the paperwork and I was free to leave my rental car in the parking lot.  As we were checking in, he said someone had checked out early that morning and he would call housekeeping and have the room ready for me by 11:30 if I would like to come back at that time. Since we had been traveling since 1:30am PST it was very much appreciated.  He recommended several restaurants and told us of the free trolly.  Upon our return, shortly after noon, he gave me the key to our room and we were very happy with the accommodations.  We had a

We had a great stay at this hotel. There was 4 of us in 2 great rooms. The staff was wonderful to us and both rooms were very clean.  It was very hot for August but the air conditioner worked hard to cool off the room and the bed was so  comfortable. The room was large enough for the 2 of us with bed and a table with 2 chairs. When all four were in one room it got tight but the balcony on the second floor room is very large. We spent a lot of time there at night and in the morning.  You can hear the ocean at night after the city gets quite. After reading the reviews I was not sure what to expect but I would stay here again.  I have stayed at other places in Laguna at much higher prices but this is now my favorite.  You can catch the trolley from here to the main part of the

This hotel was perfect for a weekend getaway. It is a little less than a mile from downtown Laguna - we enjoyed walking into town but there was also a free shuttle with a stop across the street. There is an ocean view from the second level rooms (over a row of houses) and there are very generous sized balcony's. We slept with the door open listening to the ocean, it was great! The price was reasonable for the summer and there was beach access right behind the hotel and there were hardly any people on it. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable, and the staff were friendly.

My boyfriend and I plan a trip to Laguna every year, so we know the area pretty well. It was our first stay here, however, because the price was great for being so close to the beach. We had to try it: Pros: Proximity to the beach was great. The entire Inn has quick beach access. That really was what made our stay. Second floor views of the ocean. Close to shuttle stop and decent proximity to downtown LB.  Cons: Small everything. There was no full-length mirror which was a little frustrating. The A/C was LOUD. Tip: when you're out for the day, leave it on so when you get back you don't have to listen to it. There's no full breakfast which ended up being a real problem for us (our fault, next time we'll stay at a place that does).  The place looked old, even for being recently

Great value for a hotel in a beautiful beach town. Ocean views from a private balcony and access to a private beach. A bit noisy as it is off of PCH, but the rooms were quaint and very clean. The office staff was very friendly and accommodating. I will definitely stay here again.

I made reservations 6 months prior to my check-in date. I show up only to be told they are sold out and only have one room left which was in their lobby upstairs. Manager said they have ‚Äúissues‚Äù with on-line reservation websites but don't worry he will show me the room ‚Äúwhere VIP‚Äôs stay‚Äù. I agreed to see the room. Asked how would I get to the room if the lobby closes at 6pm? Manager said I would have to call him on his cell phone and wait for him to arrive to open the lobby door if I wanted to get in or out. The room had A/C which you could only feel if you stood next to the unit. There was no tv and NO DRAPES! It had a sliding door that faced the street so oncoming cars would shine their headlights right onto the beds. It was 90 degrees inside the room, manager said he could

The good:  price was very reasonable during weekday from 7/8 - 7/11 compared to the other hotels in the area.(175.00nightly), refrigerator in the room with A/C, Many access to the beach, right on PCH.  It was approx 1mile from the Main area of Laguna beach.  The bad.  Room was VERY small.  For 2 adults, it had 2 full size beds but there were barely enough room to walk through. So if more then 2 adults it would be a tight fit.  Not enough spaces to put away your clothes or hang.  You have to literally live out of your suite case.  But I would recommend this hotel.  Clean and well kept area.

A beautiful location near the Surf & Sand resort hotel with a wonderful beach just a short walk away.  Rooms are clean and spacious and the staff are very nice and professional.  Free parking overnight too! Total thumbs up!

Since this was an older hotel I wasn't holding my breath that it was going to be anything other than ok but I'm glad to report I was wrong.  Granted the rooms are older but very quaint and clean.  Management and staff were very accomodating for us and made great recommendations.  Like other reviewers have noted, stay on the second floor and you won't regret it.  We stayed for a week and wished it could have been longer.

Summary Heading: A Great Room For A Great Price
Summary: Last weekend I stayed at the Seaside Laguna Inn & Suites with a couple of friends of mine. Due to the fact that it was 4th of July weekend many of the hotels in the surrounding area had increased their rates, so it was hard for us to find a reasonably priced hotel that was ocean front. We came across the Seaside Laguna Inn about a month before our trip, because we were driving around Laguna looking for a hotel to stay in on the 4th. They allowed us to look at some of their rooms that they had available for the date that we needed, and we were impressed with all of the rooms the front desk manager showed us. We ended up getting a room on the second floor, and really enjoyed watching the sunset and the ocean in the evenings. Overall, I would definitely come back and stay at the

My friend and I stayed here as we wanted to be closer to the waterfront and a little further from the main beach.  Upon arrival, management was outside, and commented that we managed to park the car (and squeeze myself out of the door), despite another guest's terrible parking job.  He welcomed us in, and the two staff were friendly and polite and provided us with all the information we needed for a good night's stay.  Upon our return later, we noticed that the management team must've spoken to my parking neighbour - as that car was straightened out and I was provided with more door space.  It was not necessary, but much appreciated.  The hotel rooms are small - the showers are little, but entirely manageable.  The room I was provided was clean, and we had a great view of the

We stayed there last summer because the rooms had been remodeled. When we arrived the room was dirty. There were stains on the bedding and hair on the bathroom. When we told management they told us we should get a different hotel because they obviously could not make us happy. Wouldn't recommend this hotel.

The floor was dirty I had to step ona rag and also the shower was so small like a closet and the room was so small and the TV only had six Chanel's this hotel stinks and also it might be close to the beach but hell if you want to have a good time stay away from this place.

Summary Heading: Lovely Hotel for a Delightful Time
Summary: My friends and I stayed at this inn for a birthday and it was wonderful!! The check-in and check-out times were very flexible. The front desk employees were also super nice and friendly in telling us about the nearby popular restaurants and cafes walking distance from the inn. Staying at this inn was a divine experience; it honestly felt like a beach getaway.   The hotel has so many pros! -Clean, remodeled, has a vintage feel to it -Complimentary facilities: minifridge, TV/cable, internet wifi, parking, breakfast -Location is amazing, less than a few yards from the ocean front -Very reasonably priced -Comfortable and warm sheets  My friends and I enjoyed it immensely! I would definitely recommend it to anyone!

Summary Heading: The Best Inn You Will Find On the Beach
Summary: I stayed here for the first time over spring break, and my sister and I really enjoyed it. We went on this trip wanting a relaxing beach weekend getaway, and we experienced this, and much more thanks to the Seaside Laguna Inn. This Inn definitely exceeded my expectations, especially since the inn itself is very reasonably priced. The hotel itself not only makes you feel like you are at your own private beach house, but it also is great because it is close to the heart of Laguna beach. The hotel is a short walking distance from the ocean, probably like a minute walk, and has a great view of the incredible ocean on all of the inn's second story rooms. Overall, if you are looking for a relaxing vacation, definitely book your hotel at the Seaside Laguna Inn & Suites.

I've stayed at this inn three times(once myself, once with friends, and once with my family) and have been very satisfied every time!! The people at the front desk were very accommodating!   +Free parking, no additional charge like other places +Literally steps away from the shore +Pretty quiet and peaceful at night +Clean and well-kept rooms +Beautiful view from the second floor +Free wifi and cable  +Great reasonable price for an inn right by the shore +Complimentary Breakfast  I love this place! And being a regular at Laguna, it's my favorite inn to stay at because of all it's PROs

My husband surprised me with a one-night stay at this place.  I didn't even get as far as seeing a room.  After parking I walked to what I thought was the office for check-in.  A man who said he was the manager came running out of the other side of the hotel literally screaming at me, "hey you teenage punk, you cannot park here for beach access!".  (I'm 45 years old by the way).  I told him I was looking for check-in and he didn't apologize but rudely said that I should pay more attention next time!  After looking at my ID and establishing that I did have a reservation, he still did not apologize.  When I called him on it, he told me to "get out".  I asked for the owners and he told me they were out of the country and it was his job to manage the place and his decisions were

Just a overnight visit and treat for my son who is in the Army and stationed in the desert. The room was charming-small, two very comfortable queen beds on the ground floor with an updated bathroom. The bathroom was a confusing juxtaposition of updates and needing updates-lovely vanity with large vessel sink and marble countertops, black and white tile floors, then old toilet and shower tile. Everything was clean and comfortable-and very close to Agate Beach.  The gentleman in the office was warm and friendly and the whole experience was relaxing and worth spoiling my kid for.  Internet is seriously spotty.

A friend of mine and I decided to spend the week in Laguna Beach for Spring Break. We found this place online and at first, we were skeptical. But, when we arrived we were VERY pleased we chose Seaside Laguna Inn. The owners are extremely knowledgeable about the town and where to eat and what to see. The room met our needs perfectly. It's not a typical "chain hotel", but the clean room suited our needs. We were in a queen/ocean view and the balcony was great. For the price, the view was fine. You do see some roofs, but again, not a huge deal when you still have the ocean in the background. For the price, it was well worth it, especially considering how expensive other hotels are in Laguna AND that we were there for a week. We look forward to coming back to this wonderful place!

BEWARE!!  DO NOT COME HERE! this hotel has a major COCKROACH infestation!! The first thing I got as guest besides the rude manager or owner TINO  were two cockroaches on the ceiling! When taking a shower I must have seen three cockroaches in the bathroom! The rooms are extremely dirty which is probably why they have this problem. After my discovery of the unbearable living conditions I went to talk to management Some Jerk off manager or owner named TINO that I could barely understand with his horrible accent  said if we didn't like it we could leave! I can't believe this place hasn't been shut down with how dirty and filthy it is!! DO NOT Come here! You're better off going to a motel 6!
Manager Response: Dear John,  Pls. know that we've changed all the furniture, completely remodeled every room, and that our pest control company has cleaned every corner. Also, you'll be happy to know that we have established a new management team! We hope that you'll stay with us again and allow us to make it up to you.

Summary: I had to fly in with one day's notice to take care of some business and needed to find a cheap, decent room to offset the high priced airfare.  I chose Seaside as the price was right for basic room.  It's a family run property and the owner Majid, and brother-in-law, Tino are warm, gracious. and hospitable.  Basic room had a bed, table w. two chairs, free wifi, a tv, closet, and bathroom w. shower stall. Basic, no frills, clean, sufficient. It's near everything in downtown Laguna Beach and the ocean and beach are right behind the property. If you're budget conscious, this is a good enough place that will meet your needs.

Spent our Valentines Weekend in Laguna Beach and couldn't be happier.  The key to this hotel is the one and only Tino!  Tino gave us the best recommendations for dinner, lunch, breakfast, activities, secret beach spots, and was the most polite person I have ever experienced while staying as a guest at a hotel/resort/inn.The rooms are very clean, beds are super comfortable, and location is Prime spot for walking everywhere good. Highly recommend this hotel for the price, location and BEST service. Thank you TINO! We will be back soon and often.

Laguna Beach has always been a classic spot for my friends and I to surf and hang around. We've been to many hotels that are overpriced, unfriendly, or just straight-up not worth the hype. After reading the reviews for this motel, I was ambivalent since there were many great reviews, but also a few not so great ones. After staying at the inn for 3 days, I loved it! Every day, I would wake up to a beautiful view and the beach would be literally STEPS away from the motel. Even though the rooms were the biggest, they were very comfortable, fresh, and clean. There was never that old stench that I would find at other hotels that haven't renovated their furniture in a while. The service was amazing! Managers were super friendly and helpful. I am definitely coming back to this inn for

We enjoyed our stay here very much. Very friendly Managers and we loved the sundowner on our balcony with a nice view on the ocean. We would recommend it and come back if possible. Nice thai restaurant just on the other side of the street.

I was looking for a ocean view, beautiful room for my boyfriend's birthday getaway.  Read the reviews on this place and it was mixed. But at the time I didn't have much to choose from.  When we arrived. .the room was very small and very basic. This was after the renovation.  Not what I was expecting. The "ocean view" was an ocean view but I had houses below me, their yard, etc. I was disappointed in that. But after a couple of days I was enjoying it. In the early morning it was peacful sitting on the balcony. I just overlooked the houses. The customer service was great. I would recommend this place but just know what you are expecting. Not the greatest but its do able.

We drove 6 hours a from Phoenix AZ and arrived about 7:30. When checking in we were told the AC unit in our room had broken 2 weeks prior. The room was very small and very hot as it had been in the 90s all weekend. When asked if they could fix the AC they said they could not because it needed to be replaced. They had 2 weeks to take care of this problem or notify me. I had the room booked for months. They only offered to discount our room a total of $35 for 3 nights stay which is next to nothing and basically told me I could take it or leave. This was a busy Holliday weekend and they left us scrambling to find a comfortable room to save our vacation. Never experienced service like this. Aweful!!

Summary Heading: Worst hotel we have ever stayed in.
Summary: We had an awful stay here in June 2013. The rooms were small, pokey, unclean and claustrophobic. The management were rude and hostile, to the point of trying to have a stand up row in front of my (young) family. Laguna Beach is a lovely resort with much to recommend, except this bottom rung motel.  We found out to our complete disappointment that the rooms are not as described, and that should you enquire for confirmation you will be misled or ignored.  To give a clue as to how poor the place is, inadequate the rooms, and how utterly disgusting the management treated us - I made a complaint though another site that i had made the booking. seaside laguna motel (for that is what this truly is) accepted that they had misled us with their descriptions and photos. However, I am yet

Summary Heading: Great hotel for someone on a budget.
Summary: We were satisfied with our stay (ie room was clean and location to beach was great with just a short walk down the road) however the the rooms were very noisy! During the night we could hear the next people beside us snoring! We had to have the fan running so we could try to ignore the stranger snoring in the room beside us. The walls seemed paper thin. It felt as if our bed was on the sidewalk as we heard sirens and cars all night long. If you are a light sleeper would not recommend this hotel for that reason. They could use some more insulation as it was pretty bad.  If that doesn't bother you definitely request the top floor as previous reviews say you can see the ocean over the rooftops of the houses.

We were very pleasantly surprised by our stay at Seaside. After driving round Laguna at 6pm on a Saturday night trying to find accommodation, and only finding a few foul smelling rooms at extortionate prices, we called Seaside and they said it looked like they had a no show and to come by. We were greeted warmly and shown a large suite with balcony and kitchenette at a reasonable price. All was perfectly clean and parking outside was free (this isn't the case in a lot of places around here!). We were given great tips on restaurants and things to do in the area and generally made to feel very welcome. We really enjoyed our stay here and will definitely go back

Planning on staying in Laguna Beach to attend pageant of the masters, we began our search for a close, affordable hotel. Since we were only staying for one night our choices were limted but we decided on Seaside Laguna Inn and Suites. I always check trip advisor first before booking and to be honest I was a little nervous based on the reviews. However, when we arrived we were pleasantly suprised. We reserved the king bed room and it was an quaint, cute room. It was modern, clean and updated. we even had our own balcony. It was perfect! I would absolutely stay here again.  The only draw back was that there seemed to be a celebratory group of people in the room above us, but when we notified management they quickly took care of it and they occupants quieted down. Great service!

Our research led us to expect better. Perhaps we got one of the worst rooms (it does seem that this is a hotel you should ask to see particular rooms). Our room was very small with a tiny unrenovated bathroom. There was a small pedestal sink and no room to put anything. Shower was a small stall that was quite worn out. The shower head was too low to stand under and I am only 5'8". We did find the bed comfortable and the room kept clean (though the worn bathroom did not look clean even when clean). At a minimum steer clear of room 110.

Summary Heading: A bit of a reality check
Summary: We were so excited to try out this hotel based on the positive reviews. I saw one recent bad review and figured it came from someone who was "a complainer". He complained it was dirty- I didn't find it dirty but it seems like the renovation was interrupted or they ran out of money. The rooms are very small, no biggie, but the toilets have to be flushed 3 times for the paper to go down. They replaced the mirror in the bathroom with a smaller mirror and didn't bother to fix the wall where you can see they ripped the old one off. They didn't patch holes in the walls and they did nothing to soundproof the place. We had an upstairs ocean view room. You can hear the ocean in-between  the street noise of cars and motorcycles. You can also hear every word and way more than you  want to

Definately not the st Regis but awesome beach hotel. The two gentalman who operate the hotel were the best. Remembered my name and were very welcoming. The rooms were very clean and the beds were comfortable. The pillows were the upgrade pillows instead of the cheap standard pillows. I would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Well located on the beach side of the Coast Highway.
Summary: A nice place to stay for a nite after attending the Laguna Beach Pageant of the Masters. Room 110 was a small European sized room but more than OK for one nite. The queen sized bed pretty much filled the room but was comfortable and the sheets and pillows were clean. Likewise the tiny bathroom was clean and the towels, while not plush nor large, were adequate as were the little soaps, lotion and shampoo. It is located on the beach side of the Coast Highway and serviced by the free Laguna Shuttle which made it a piece of cake getting to and from the Pageant. The front desk staff were nice and helpful - pointed out where to catch the free shuttle and gave us a great recommendation for lunch (rooftop of the Casa del Camino hotel with a nice ocean view). While nothing is cheap in

First off let me say, 2 years ago I started the painstaking journey of working on a business called AlertTheGlobe.com. A month after the 'dream' (read about it on alerttheglobe.com) I was walking the streets of Laguna Beach and stumbled on Seaside Laguna Inn at the end of town, kind of. I walked in to check room availability and ended up practically staying there on and off for months and months. My home is Mt. Shasta Ca and my office was in Burbank, but Laguna was calling me, for I love the ocean. Well I loved staying at Seaside quite a bit. It was nice and clean and the views are the best. But what I loved most was the two gentlemen I met, Majic and Tino. These two souls are probably the warmest, kindest people one could meet. They were not just Hotel Managers, they were

Summary Heading: Clean and comfortable with a reasonable price
Summary: We were greeted by a very friendly young lady who was efficient and took care of all our needs.  We were so happy with the location, which was right on the free trolley circuit.  The rooms are small, but the bed was comfortable, and the room was clean, with a freh scent.  I wish there had been a pool, but we were on the ocean side of the street.

This "hotel" is dirty and poorly provided. If it were a hostel it would be among the lower rated. The floor, simulated wood composite, turned my feet black from dirt and grime. I think that it is merely swept out and rarely washed. There was hair in the shower. Everything is of the lowest quality. The two plastic cups are so thin that they distort with the lightest touch. No mirror other than a small one over the basic sink, which still has what looks like encrusted tooth paste on the faucet. There are who knows what kind of stains,some kind of greasy substance on the lamp shade. We have stayed at hotels in USA, Europe, Turkey, Israel, Greece, and Asia. A few of them were very basic. This hotel is equivalent to the most basic one we stay at, however even those were clean. The

Summary Heading: Great little ocean view hotel in Laguna
Summary: I did a lot of research trying to find a reasonable, nice seaside hotel with an ocean view in Laguna.  This was a great choice.  Recently remodeled so everything was nice.  It was great to wake up and see/hear the ocean (2nd floor rooms).  This is not a fancy hotel but it is clean, comfortable and nice.  It was an easy walk to great restaurants for breakfast and dinner and a reasonable walk into town.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  We had a delightful time.  This place will now be our "go to" place when we stay in Laguna.

This Hotel was every thing they said it was. Friendly staff affordable prices and the rooms are remodled. The rooms are very clean, they have hardwood floors, nice bathroom appliances, although they still need to replace a few things in the bathroom. The sheets felt clean the beds are very comfy to get a restfull nights sleep, and the beach access is right around the corner. Will definitly come back to this hotel.

My family and i just spent five nights at this hotel.  We had originally booked a room on the first floor, but when we asked if we could change our room to one with a bathtub instead of shower, they very nicely put us in another room which was on the second floor and had a fabulous view of the ocean.  A young woman named Jasmine very nicely wrote down a list of restaurant recommendations for us and they were all excellent.  The hotel is very nicely kept - rooms are new and clean and well-kept.  I would definitely stay at this hotel again.  Prices are very reasonable for Laguna Beach, which tends to be expensive.

(+) Literally a few steps away from the ocean. It's the perfect location, close to coffee shops and other  (+) Newly renovated = modern and classic designs  (+) Complimentary Breakfast (+) Great staff: super friendly people who were happy to guide me with directions and inform me about the well-known restaurants and boutiques around (+) Very Comfortable room with a beautiful view of Laguna Beach (+) Clean amenities, brand new furniture with fresh smelling linens and fluffy pillows (+) Got a nice rest: environment was peaceful and serene (+) Roof top space to relax and take in the amazing view (+) Free high-speed Internet, TV, refrigerator  I couldn't have asked for a better experience at Seaside Laguna Inn for my weekend getaway. A 10/10 for me! I'd definitely bring my entire

Cute cottage style rooms with soft plush linens. My experience was enjoyable with the ease of making reservations and checking in with Katie Pittman. She was accommodating and offered valuable information about nearby restaurants and venues. The reason for 4 stars is the breakfast of a packaged Danish and coffee didn't seem appetizing. I really don't consider this to be a breakfast. Otherwise it would have been 5 stars!!

This newly remodeled inn is the perfect place for relaxation and cleansing the soul. In the midst of beautiful Laguna, it's only steps away from the beach. I stayed at the hotel with a few friends and it was a really serene, clean, and wonderful.  The staff was extremely friendly and helpful in showing us around and telling us great places to eat at or shop at around the area. There was also complementary breakfast in the morning - simple, light, delicate.   All the recent renovations made the stay even more enjoyable. All the furniture looked very new and clean with the modern yet elegant decor.  Overall, my friends and I had a unforgettable experience and we would most definitely stay at Seaside Laguna again!

I rarely stay at hotels. It's hard to justify spending over $100/night anywhere I can drive to but Laguna Beach was  a gem without breaking the bank. Such a great little place!  My husband and I wanted  getaway and this little spot was perfect for it. Located a view away from the ocean and steps to the sand. The Manager that was there  was great and although had just started there, you could tell she was happy to be there! The rooms are definitely cute and clean but we didn't spend much time in it because Laguna is just so beautiful that all we did was walk. This hotel served its purpose.    We had the most beautiful time here. Walking distance to some amazing restaurants art gallerys and shopping centers. Not to mention the lil cove right down the street  If you're not into
Manager Response: Hi Kim,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review. We are delighted that you found us and had a great family vacation. We hope to see you in the future, be sure to ask about our Starfish Suite, this room would be quite comfortable for your family. It features a king size bed and two sofa sleepers as well as ocean view balcony and kitchenette with granite counter tops, coffee maker, microwave and toaster oven.   Thanks for taking a chance on us!  Best regards, Dana K. Race General Manager

Summary Heading: Clean. Basic. Friendly. Renovated in October 2012!
Summary: If you're looking for a clean, basic, friendly, economical place to stay in Laguna this is it!   We usually stay here when we come to Laguna.   We're the type who have felt at home in fancy places like the Montage (Laguna Beach) and the Taj Lake Palace (Udaiper, India) as well as modest means like a sleeping bag on the ground next to a dirt road (Cinque Terre, Italy) or a 10 hour cramped bus ride (that broke down) in Cambodia.   The point is, we're not fussy travelers. We can go with the flow and have a good time wherever we are or whatever the budget may be.  The Eco Inn is steps from the beach and some rooms have an ocean view. Yes, there is a row of private homes between you and the ocean but the rooms are on the second floor looking OVER the homes. This is a VERY humble place but clean and good location. Staff very freindly. Clean pool too. Thye served coffe in the morning with simple pastries. They could improve the room decor a bit and add newer details like new blankets, block out courtins etc. If you want a cheap but clean place to stay that's your spot
Manager Response: Hi Helena,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review. We are glad that you enjoyed your stay last summer and wanted to let you know that our property has undergone a complete renovation. We have raised the bar and have all new beds and furniture, as well as new wood floors and new bathrooms and windows!  We hope to see you this summer, as a former guest, you will surely appreciate the upgrades! Laguna Beach awaits you :).   Best regards, Dana K. Race General Manager

Summary Heading: Best kept secret in Laguna Beach
Summary: If you are looking for a cost effective place to stay in Laguna Beach. I think this is the hotel. Although small and a little older, we were very happy. Steps away from the beach, you can walk to nearby restauants and shops... best of all, the staff was very friendly. Tino, the general manager was very friendly and provided excellent customer service. Being a family of four that included two children, 8 and 10, we realized that the regular rooms were too small for our family. We will plan on staying there again..but in a suite. Not the Hilton, but for the price, well worth it.
